arguments.value: Caller is not a registered patie

deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Caller is not a registered patient"

arguments.value: Caller is not a registered patient

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Caller is not a registered patient"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Caller is not a registered provider"

arguments.value: Caller is not a registered provider

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Caller is not a registered provider"

documentation.text:
@dev Registers a new patient.
 The caller's wallet address (msg.sender) becomes their unique ID.
@dev Registers a new provider (hospital, doctor, pharmacy).

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string storage ref[] storage pointer,string storage ref)

documentation.text:
@dev Adds a new record's IPFS hash to the patient's profile.
 This can only be called by a registered patient.
 (In real system, you might let a provider upload *for* a patient,
 but this "patient-upload" model is simpler to start with).

@dev Revokes a provider's access to a specific record.
 Only the patient can call this.
@dev Fetches all record hashes for the calling patient.

@dev NEW FUNCTION: Allows a provider (or public) to see the list of records
 for a specific patient address. This is required for the Provider Search.

devdoc.details: Manages patient-centric access control for Electronic Health Records (EHR's). Patients can register, upload record hashes (from IPFS), and grant/revoke access to those records for healthcare providers. All access attempts are logged as events for an immutable audit trail.

checkAccess(address,address,string).details: Allows anyone (e.g., the backend server) to check if provider has access to a patient's record. This is a public "view" function, so it doesn't cost any gas to call.

getMyRecords().details: Fetches all record hashes for the calling patient.

getPatientRecords(address).details: NEW FUNCTION: Allows a provider (or public) to see the list of records for a specific patient address. This is required for the Provider Search.

grantAccess(address,string).details: Grants a provider access to a specific record. This is the core patient-consent function. Only the patient can call this.

registerPatient(string).details: Registers a new patient. The caller's wallet address (msg.sender) becomes their unique ID.

registerProvider(string,string).details: Registers a new provider (hospital, doctor, pharmacy).

revokeAccess(address,string).details: Revokes a provider's access to a specific record. Only the patient can call this.

uploadRecord(string).details: Adds a new record's IPFS hash to the patient's profile. This can only be called by a registered patient. (In real system, you might let a provider upload *for* a patient, but this "patient-upload" model is simpler to start with).

permissions.details: The core of the system. This nested mapping checks permissions. Format: mapping(patientAddress => mapping(providerAddress => mapping(recordHash => hasAccess)))

devdoc.title: AccessControl
